mcdYcAM0M1KC53hg79Rw4g.text: This was the first restaurant me and my wife came to upon moving to Charlotte, and we had good food and a great time.   Recently we returned expecting more of the same, but that is not at all what we got. At some point they totally changed up the menu from fine dining to more of a overpriced tapas mess.  They still listed a few entrees, so I ordered scallops from the entree menu. The restaurant was not busy but our food took a half hour to come out, our waiter was trying and came over to tell us he had checked on the food and it would be out soon.  When the food finally came, there were exactly 2 scallops on the plate and the meal was $27.  Seriously, $27 for 2 scallops and they took a half an hour.  Silly.

Jl1kBfv04DIfU15vWsV-jQ.text: What a terrific meal!  We loved the menu from the pate, to the beef carpaccio, to the scallops, everything was well prepared and tasty. Make sure to order the brussel sprout side, it was amazing!

2zdQQYPtFcFBcHUIarL8Ng.text: Fantastic!  My coworkers and I ate on a weeknight  - the place was just about empty, which I found suprising since the food turned out to be awesome.  Nice ambiance, while our waiters were knowledgable and efficient and friendly, not a fan of wait staff that aren't cross trained or authorized (?) to handle all requests.   We tried a bunch of dishes - we started with the olives. Excellent. We then had a meat and cheese platter - the items with their accompaniments were all excellent. We especially liked the chorizo and the country pate.  I ordered the WTF pork chop with spaetzel - solid dish, though the pork chop could have been a bit more juicy. overall the dish was solid. I also tried my coworker's dishes - pumpkin gnochi was delicous as was the ricotta gnocchi with eggplant. My other coworker's ribeye deckle was also delicious, though still not entirely sure what part of the cow is the deckle. Nice to see some interesting cut.  We ordered a side of brussel sprouts which were delicious. Even the people at the table who didn't like brussel sprouts loved them. I swear, brussel sprouts taste much better now than they did when I was a kid. The only dissapointment of the night was the potato fingerlings with horseradish. No heat - just some boring roasted potatoes.  Wine service was solid with a lot of interesting choices.  I'd highly recommend this place for a comforting meal.

YhJzH_Cucb9Ct6CWGOWLDg.text: Very disappointed in a number of areas; seating requested a different location as we were situated right by the kitchen door. At first denied then another nice gentleman said he wanted to seat us where we originally requested. Wine: requested the Malbec and received a different kind than ordered. The waitress tried to tell us initially it was what we ordered but we knew it was wrong. She returned and admitted it was wrong but said it was the more expensive bottle ( by $20)however upon checking, it was another lower grade Malbec. Unlikely to return.

2ekqzwznYgFQVdilkdSquQ.text: Wow, Customshop had a busy week this week in reviews! The hubster took me here for my birthday, and we had a 5 star experience so I am sad to see Diana's bad experience. We didn't have a reservation so we snuck in early and were lucky enough to get a booth, which are definitely more comfy than the interior tables (just like any restaurant).   I have always loved their interior, lighting and vibe. To me, this is the perfect size of a restaurant- cozy, small, neighborhoody, exclusive.  It is not a place you go everyday because of the cost and small menu size which is the reason I docked it a star. They change up the menu and this time there were only 2-3 entrees I could eat because of my rule that I won't eat an animal I've had as a pet and I've had a lot of pets.   Anyway, our wonderful waiter Bill was friendly, funny and attentive. He introduced us to Black Slate piorat wine which became my husband's new favorite wine! We noshed on the delicious bread drizzled with divine olive oil and fresh crushed black pepper- OMG.  Then we ordered the scallops and I had the whole fish special (snapper) with preserved lemons and pesto tossed arugula which was heaven on a plate. Hubby's scallops were perfect for someone on a diet, and definitely a "chick" dish so it was good that my fish was large enough to share. And he had a big cake at home for me. If I were planning to have scallops next time, I would also order the beef carpaccio or another starter. At the end of the night, the bill was $125.  I enjoyed it immensely so we were happy paying it.   I have had their squid ink pasta before with a different prep and it was wonderful.  Unfortunately I'm not a charcuterie/cheese person at all, so that specialty is wasted on me entirely. That's OK, I enjoy every other part of it.  I don't think I've ever had a dessert here (shocker) because I tend to get homemade ice cream next door at Elizabeth Creamery.

HWoKj6f0CbGID6XT3z-0EA.text: The first time I went to Customshop I wasn't super impressed. My food was overly salty and just flavor-wise it was off. Went on Friday for a Birthday dinner and I have to say they really pulled it together this time.  The venue itself is awesome- beautiful candles line the walls and big comfy booths are there to relax in. This is the type of restaurant where you stay and relax for awhile.  Started with some excellent wine selections - our server was more than accommodating in this arena.   Wasn't very impressed with the fried goat cheese. They were sort of bland and I was hoping for a savory dish rather than sweet.   The Ahi tuna and scallops were amazing - as were the two gnocchi dishes I tasted.  So while they missed the boat on the appetizer, they definitely made up for it with the entrees. The meals were both creative and tasty, so I look forward to my next visit!

IQcZQMZxyKleznQ7N5bXSA.text: There are only a few restaurants in Charlotte that I consider a True culinary experience. This is by far the best restaurant in the city. I've read a few of the bad reviews on here and it seems like they either have a unfounded problem with this establishment or are completely ignorant to what an amazing dining experience should consist of.  When people complain about things like I've read on here it shows there pretentiousness.  The service is up there with the best I've ever had, the prices for the quality of ingredients is on par with any other restaurant, the chefs are some of the most creative in the country and the owner truly cares about every single aspect of bringing cutting edge cuisine.  I truly hope this review might help someone look beyond a few inexperienced reviews, from people that haven't traveled and experienced real upscale and creative dining and give Custom Shop a try.  I promise, you will not regret it.

OWkVp1ioTrpECY0C6jAfVg.text: My wife and I consider ourselves aspiring foodies, so its no big surprise that we really like Customshop. I can understand that a bad experience there could really turn you off -- it isn't an inexpensive night out, and I suspect the food they serve could alienate the Groupon crowd that they have cultivated (I count 3 or 4 Groupons in the last year). But we've had nothing but really exceptional meals.  We have alternated cheese/charcuterie and crudo for two the last few times, and enjoy them both. I have succumbed to the pork chop several times because it is awesome, but have also enjoyed their specials.  It would be a five-star restaurant except for the jacked-up wine prices (nearly 200% -- $14 bottle for $39) and the occasional snooty server experience. But neither have distracted us from making this one of our "Top-5 Restaurants in Charlotte." It would be 4.5 stars if such a rating existed.

aCW2_qfG1Lt63mk3LfQkog.text: This is one of my favorite local restaurants in Charlotte.  Good food in a nice atmosphere. I love the octopus and the yellow fin tuna.

clqQnO5R6UXahm4ZygH8uw.text: The owner/chef came over to our table and sent out amazing selections all night long. Some things I would have never ordered on my own but so glad I tried them. Everything was delicious and I want to go back again. I love restaurants that serve high quality, fresh food.

Dt_DeunaWbsPiayKCksWkQ.text: Went there for the first time for a couple of drinks before heading to Visulite.  Sat at the bar.  My wife wanted a martini.  Although they weren't on the menu, the bartender made one up.  That's the good part.  The not so good: it was about half full and only once we got the bill did we realize they were $12 apiece.  Combined with my weak mixed drinks, a $50 (with tip) tab for four mediocre drinks left us with a sour taste in our mouths.  Sitting at the end of the bar next to the door is esp awkward.  Having people hover around you is not what anyone would want.  Instead of cramming in as many tables as possible, perhaps they should have inlcuded a little more room for people to, I don't know, get in the door and wait to be seated.  The food might be great but I'm in no hurry to go back and find out.

Oft8x-wLOReX8AJ4VSrnFw.text: Had dinner at Customshop last night with a friend.  We were seated promptly.  The wine list was decent though some of the by glass options were grossly overpriced.  (Granted, most wine by the glass is overpriced, but in this case I was somewhat shocked.)    The main reason I was brought here was to try their charcuterie.  Three meats (salame Toscana, prosciutto, and sweet dry sausage) along with two cheeses - Roaring 40s blue and Manchego.   The meats were excellent and well portioned. The cheeses were good, but the portions were minute. When compared to Good Food, even the now gone yet venerable Las Ramblas - it was very disappointing.  During this time our server started to really pressure us into making our decision for a main course, siting an 11-top that would delay our dinner if we got stuck behind them.  We looked after he left and there was no such group at that time.  However, we placed our starters and main orders asking them to take their time.    My friend had the Ambrosia Corn salad and said it was excellent.  I had the carpaccio which was divine.  If you're a beef person, and you like carpaccio - this is some of the best I've ever had and it was very well presented. Normally I get worried when I see "horseradish" on a carpaccio because it is usually way more than necessary. Customshop put just enough that it is discernible on the palate but it doesn't over power or burn. It was far more in the nose than on the tongue.    For our main course - my friend had the potato gnocchi with lamb ragu and i had the duck confit.  The duck was superb. Well cooked, tender, worked well with the salsify, fingerling potoatoes, and fig reduction.  My friend, however, did not have an ideal experience.   The gnocchi was overcooked, and the sauce was tasteless- with the lamb well past being over cooked even for a ragu.   It lacked any type of salt in the dish.  Our waiter, noting that the bowl of ragu wasn't being touched, asked what was going on.  To Customshop's credit, they sent out the ricotta gnocchi with rabbit and tomato.  It was amazingly good.  A far cry from the mess that was previously there.    Dessert comes around chocolate souffle and bread pudding are ordered.  The bread pudding took the prize.  Custard-y and delicious it was one of the best bread puddings in Charlotte.  The chocolate souffle, however, lacked any serious depth to it.  The chocolate was there, and the sugar was there - but once the taste on the front end left, it was gone.  It also seemed rather undercooked in places.  During dessert, the server placed the check on the table - not even asking if we might want more wine or coffee.  Again, the rushed feeling.   Somewhere between 2.5 and 3 stars seems fair.  The food was hit and miss.  When you got something good - it was excellent, but when you got something bad, it wasn't worth eating.   The service, for the most part was good - but the rushed feeling was not.  As we were getting ready to leave, the 11-top was just coming in.

VFLi7ZKfh0pVJ_YP0zvW-A.text: Went to Customshop for anniversary dinner last night.  We were not disappointed!  Our server was very attentive and answered all our questions.  The recommended wine was great and she served a generous pour. I had the pork chop which was awesome and my husband raved about the ribeye.  We will definitely go back.

UUlhQryHJluB8c4db3VFwA.text: This place is ROCK SOLID.  (3 stars is very good from me, I'm trying to fight star inflation)  Really good restaurants are really really scarce in Charlotte, but Customshop is squarely on the list of really good ones (a very short list).  We went in on a rainy Monday and while it wasn't packed they were doing a good business.  The cheese/olive/charcuterie selections are very good.  They could have probably parted with a little more of the prosciutto but what the heck.  Terrific wine list.  Some excellent selections at almost every price point.  Two spots that they did fall down on in this area were vintages that are not up to date on the list, and high end red wines are served at room temperature.  We had an excellent 2006 Palacios that was as warm as bathwater.  This even after I specifically asked if the reds were kept in a cooler?  Management should address this issue immediately.   We split a butter lettuce salad, it was simple and excellent.  My date had the saffron fettuccine with shrimp, it was delicious.  I had the crispy duck breast and it too was very good.  Some of the reviews here seem to indicate that people think the duck breast isn't "crispy" enough, I thought it was fine.  In addition, our server was aware of this issue and talked with us about it up front.  Speaking of servers, ours (nice young NYU grad) did a fine job and was very pleasant (but I was disappointed about the temperature of the wine).  The room is very very well done from an ambiance perspective.  Net/net, the people at Customshop should be proud.   I do not live in Charlotte full-time but am often there.  I can't remember the last time I left a restaurant in Charlotte thinking "you know, that was really really good"....Customshop fills the void!  By the time we finished they were ready to close so can't comment on the desserts but I will be back another time to check those out!!  Keep up the good work.

A6ZLYGnt59pARIkXTvKe1w.text: Was able to walk in on Mother's Day and get a seat on the small (very small) front patio for brunch.  Ordered chorizo fritatta which was really good with just a nice kick from the chorizo.  Used the Elderflower Mimosa to tame the spice - and just to make sure the fire was all out - have another Mimosa - hey it was Mom's Day and Mom wanted a Mimosa!  All in all, very nice brunch.  Only complaint was for sweet potato hash and rib eye, rib eye was very fatty and not that flavorful which was odd - think it needed more seasoning during the grilling process - was just not very flavorful for that cut of meat.

krvIwHogsghFCpsxOEAs_w.text: Now I would say the biggest highlight of this place is the decor, very charming and rustic feel to it. Low light and will have set you in the mood right off the bat.   Visited here for restaurant week and although sitting at the bar may not have been the best idea, in the end our bartender "Chip" was very attentive and explained the menu to us fully and made up for the entire evening.   Onto my main course. The yellowtail tuna (imported from hawaii) Deliciously seared with pepper and some other fine marinates. Delicious and well proportioned. My date enjoyed the tuna meatballs and pasta dish which was also delicious and was served with house made pasta. Both dished were delightful  I had the bread-pudding desert and all I have to say is HOT DAMN THAT SHIT WAS GOOD!!!

P3dYI-2OZB9esABQt1UAuQ.text: A great location for a restaurant that offers great promise. The problem Customshop has is consistency! Our course came out at different time for different members of our 4 guest party, sometimes as much as 5 minutes between when the first person got their plate until the last.  Some of the food was outstanding, the BBQ octopus, some had no flavor at all, the spicy tuna meatballs. Some would have been excellent, the duck breast, if there was enough sauce to go with the nice sized portion.    All this coupled with service that mirrored the food. There were times when it was attentive and professional and others, they must cherish their water because trying to get a refill is a chore, that the servers seemed pre occupied with the theory of relativity.    Customshop has great promise if it only had consistency

kx5zYLYkGv_Wr2IFKyRdGw.text: Don't get me wrong I still love Customshop but my experience the last time I was here was meh.  It was a busy Friday night and being a former waitress I can understand being in the weeds, but my table was definitely sacrificed.  I was so excited to have the carpaccio it is one of my favorite things on the menu but it never came, are dirty martini's were not dirty - and the food overall was just blah this time around.  i guess it was just an off night.  The table next to us seemed to have a similar experience.

RmLiIOpNwX3NRLubj4mtZg.text: If you're looking for a fun, casual meal at a place where seasonal menus are embraced, then you'll love Customshop. Whenever I go here I always grab a seat at the bar and start with a glass of wine (heavy pour in a mini-carafe) and the meat and cheese plate, which they usually make right behind the bar for you by a chef. Bartenders are very knowledgeable and will strike up a conversation with ease. Take their advice on the new wines or drink specials, you won't be disappointed.   Gnocchi is great, as well as the desserts are awesome. I hardly resist the bread pudding. They sure put the love in the food! This is a local place that had some challenges with the trolley construction and deserves to stay and be a local vibrant joint in the Midtown/Elizabeth scene.   PS - you'll enjoy the scenery in the restrooms :)

SDEKm6OWb7xt-egigJ-kvw.text: This place has really taken a dive. I went out on a date last week and suggested Custom Shop. The last time I ate here was over a year ago and remembered the food was pretty good. Unfortunately that was not the case this time. I felt compelled to write a review after our experience. We ordered the cheese and charcuterie to start. The waitress brought out the wrong order but that is completely forgivable as she corrected it quickly. She said the cheese won a gold star for some cheese award so of course we had to have it. The cheese was well cheese. I am not a connoisseur of cheese but it was pretty good. Honestly I could have made this plate at home. Ok so then we ordered the BBQ Octopus small plate, again another Charlotte Observer favorite suggested by the waitress. The plate was just well weird. The ony octoupus tentacle lacked flavor other than a very burnt grill taste. Not their best dish by far. After that we had the beef carpaccio. My date had never tried it before and it is too bad he tried it here. The beef is supposed to be sliced thinly with olive oil and pepper and salt. This meat was thicker and was covered in horseradish. You could not taste the flavor of the meat at all. We had to scrape the horseradish off the and the fennel they sliced. The other thing is their complimentary bread. It was very dry and again nothing to write home about. Needless to say, I will not be going back. I think if you stick with the large plates you will be ok but their small plates lack flavor and are just weird.

uxlE41HpVt07mHVKxpBYPg.text: We have been to Customshop a few times recently...and last night was terrific...again.  I had tilefish with favabeans that were so perfectly cooked and so flavorful I might never forget it!  My husband and his buddy ordered the steak and they were both shocked at how interesting the cut was and how crisp the outside was and how moist and tender and flavorful the inside was.  Our buddy's wife had a pasta dish which she really liked, too.  I'm always amazed at the small, wonderful restaurants we have in Charlotte.  Keep up the fine work you're doing, Customshop...we'll be back!  Oh, and Chip, our server, was knowledgeable, pleasant and professional.  Nice work.

SrG07cTHHT47vs5LOabmaA.text: The Customshop is handcrafted goodness!  I had seen other great reviews for The Customshop restaurant so I had decided to take my partner there for his birthday dinner. We were impressed by the charming and comfortable interior design and overall ambiance. Our waiter, Joe, was a friendly and accommodating fellow who answered our questions and gave excellent recommendations.   We had ordered BBQ Octopus as a small plate and were delighted when we were served a grilled tentacle that was tender and flavorful. If you love seafood as much as we do, this is worth coming back to alone! My partner had ordered Smoked Duck and I, the Potato Gnocchi for our main entrees. Both dishes did not disappoint. Again, best duck we've ever had--just the right amount of crisp on the skin and juicy softness in the meat. There were so many great things going on there too with the candied cabbage, figs, and spaetzle. My dish in contrast to his had savory crawfish and pork sausage, both of which complimented the smooth, creaminess of the gnocchi.  All the food we tasted we just loved, and to top it off, the Chocolate Souffle is die for! It had a subtle espresso taste about it which went well with a scoop of their mocha ice cream. My partner who typically doesn't care for chocolate was smiling ear-to-ear. We can't say enough good things about our experience with The Customshop. It has definitely made it's way to one of our Charlotte favorites. If you're looking for a special night out and have an adventurous palate, this restaurant offers a nice variety of dishes with well-balanced flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thinkbees Knees and Spiced Old Fashion
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Octopus
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Duck

xxksWBQtS65jxvvo92vuFQ.text: I really wanted to love this popular Elizabeth Avenue eatery, but after waiting more than 30 minutes for our entrees to arrive, the food just wasn't good enough to make up the lost ground. Stopping in for an anniversary dinner, my wife and I started with an excellent bottle of Pinot and the delicious Spicy Tuna Meatballs. But even after we complained about the lengthy wait for our main dishes, it was nearly another 20 minutes before our food made an appearance.   After all that, the scallops I ordered were good, but not particularly memorable. The Yellow Fin Tuna my wife ordered, however, was excellent. I would definitely try Custom Shop again, but the needlessly long wait cost this trendy little restaurant a star on our first visit.

GTGuJS7fG61w6i2-7IgL7Q.text: One of my favorites!  Food and staff are top notch.  The entire food menu is made to taste.

wwPglPIX9N_TSg48fykFDw.text: There are too many good things to say about this place, so I won't try to begin listing them.  As a Restaurateur myself, I follow the food trends and restaurant awards in our great town...both of which are picking up quite a bit lately as Charlotte becomes a True culinary destination.   One thing I do not see enough of are high held praise for Custom Shop.  Custom Shop is one of the restaurants that helped seed the culinary scene in our town, and I think often gets overlooked by the latest and greatest.  The simple fact is there are few places in Charlotte, old or new, that execute with at same level.  CS knows what it set out to do, and does it very well.    This spot should be on your very short list of the go-to restaurants in Charlotte, plain and simple.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grouper-perfection

BCPAW9hDClcpYlL-5SS-Kg.text: Love the drinks. Love the food. Love the atmosphere.   It isn't easy to get a reservation here on peak nights, but if you do, its worth it. I love the hopping energy in the small dining room. It is a bit hipster, but in the best way possible.   The charcuterie was awesome and the drinks we really cool. I love drinks that come in the old style champagne glasses. Everything we ordered was super tasty.  I am willing to pay for good experiences and this was one I remember. I will be back.

2fxlKsxmziXKl-8c9KzHsw.text: I waited so long to write this review that there is no way I can actually give any in depth or mind blowing critiques of the food, atmosphere, or ambiance. What I can say is that I liked Customshop but didn't fall in love with it.  Ella got the gnocchi, I got the Bolognese, and we split some fingerling potatoes. Nothing was bad, nothing stood out, everything was just there... which on Elizabeth can be a dangerous. There is so much food in the area that is exceptional and competing for attention. Although we plan on making a return visit, we're not exactly tripping over ourselves to get back.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

frdGfRuMmii3C5WhpIL6nA.text: The first visit was amazing. Last night.  . . not so much.  I ordered the BBQ octopus again, and this was as tough and dry as my first try was moist and tender. Such as disappointment.  I also ordered the sweetbreads. Sweetbreads can be amazing, or, they can over fried to the point they become flavorless. I will let you guess which I was served.  My dinner partner order tuna crudo. The tuna was beautiful, but was floating in some serious liquid and oil. The server talked about how delicious this liquid would be and don't we want to dip the bread in it? Between the liquid and the spicy sauce on it, the taste of the beautiful tuna was completely masked and the liquid was not a savory delight... I can't believe what a completely different experience we had. I don't think I'll be back.

U5dzu3VPrIMwqd5KSEFnqg.text: Ambience is very chill and as u would expect. Food ok but don't expect to leave full. We got our 25$ meal and laughed. It was tiny!!!! We got two tiny pieces of bread. Omg..... the drinks were good though. Bill was $70. Totally unimpressed. Will not return.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

yq_0U07FytmVZwTPKZyZlA.text: Eaten here before and the food was great. However, sadly second visit was not a good food experience.   Tried 4 appetizers: beef carpaccio, yellowfin tuna, tuna meatballs, honeycomb. The beef carpaccio was excellent. The yellowfin was drowning in oil, taste was lost. The honeycomb was artistic but lost on taste- beets were tough and blackberries over ripe, and the pastry severed with it was bland and missed. The tuna meatballs were fishy with a flavor and texture that was unappealing and really undesirable. After a bite- we left the rest bc it was so unappetizing.   The service has been exceptional both times. Can tell people really care about what they do. Also, the bread that was brought out was very nice- good quality olive oil.  Unfortunately, based on 4 the plates we had - we would no longer recommend this restaurant for its food based on our experience.

EktL0BmRxyEOWjUHKBsN5g.text: I sort of like the interior (especially the hand-cranked meat slicer at the end of the bar), but it's rather dreary and the decorating seems to be a bit haphazard or unfinished with odd bits above the bar.  I sort of like the appetizers.  Although, hmmm... they are unmemorable as I can't remember what we tried.  We didn't have dinner here, so I can't really comment on the quality of the food.  I sort of like the cocktails.  They have a Campari Cocktail which was good.  I sort of like the bartender/server.  He acted a bit "not with it" sometimes, though.  I probably won't go back, but I would recommend it to others just based on the other Yelpers great reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. A table, waiting for you &amp; your friends...@the custom shop

ahWXSQVsvGXXwShAzNKoZA.text: I was way out of my comfort zone here. Menu choices were not appealing to me. The wine was good and the service excellent. I felt entrees very pricey and small plates a good option. Dessert menu was my favorite. Our dishes were okay but not anything I'd rave about. It's a one and done for me.

FAcY625FRvR275wPguEW4A.text: "This place has Great food" is an understatement.  The whole vibe of the place is so cool. aThe food was amazing and very reasonable size for what you're puttin down. I came with a large group and our service was great everything was on time. It gets rather loud surprisingly but it is a small space for a very niche southern eclectic little restaurant. Definitely coming back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallops.
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Duck and peaches. Fucking awesome

o9LYJr6LNtIhOgiJMsR3sg.text: Not terribly impressed by our choices, but it's apparent that the chef is talented.  We had two pasta dishes and while the pasta was cooked perfectly in both dishes, the flavor was lacking.  The Cocoa Rigatoni's protein is a wonderful braised short rib.  The Tomato and Pimento Linguine's flavor was over powered by the smokiness of the Surryano ham ( not a fan).  The Skillet Brussel Sprouts were incredible and the highlight of the meal.  We'll be back to try some of the other dishes, but this experience doesn't have us rushing back.

_VXssqATkkGJohx-kH5JOA.text: My wife and I had the pleasure to attend another group dinner hosted by a great friend of ours.   This restaurant is on the expensive side but the food was definitely worth the price. I had the pleasure of ordering the Garnanelli Pasta; a pasta dish with Carolina shrimp, artichokes, some bacon and delicious sauce.  The treat of my night was trying out the "Evil Twin Yang" beer; a Taiji double IPA brewed in Brooklyn, NY.  Popular dessert: Breading Pudding - it was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Random photo of the nice restroom lol

gJiKc4o02-9W1ivAnOC7bQ.text: This place changes the game in Charlotte. All fresh all cooked to perfection. Real cannot Waite to go back. Scallops were excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese and sausage

rMoX_DBEkcEbfDJja4BRzw.text: I really want to give this place two stars, but the touch of complimentary service brings this place up to three stars.  Came here after work on a Tuesday last month to meet up a couple of friends and try out their happy hour/appetizer menu.  FOOD - We tried a bevy of appetizers to go with our drinks while sitting at the bar.  Maybe it was our selection, but everything just kinda tasted the same.  What a misnomer, huh?  Should be Customshop Blandcrafted Food.  Without going through the apps, the one item I thought was really good is the carpaccio.  Wasabi-fiends would appreciate the hint of wasabi on the carpaccio, it really gives it a good kick (and takes care of allergies).  SERVICE - Maybe we looked like a couple of fatties or something, but the bartender brought us out a free skirt steak to enjoy.  Literally get an extra star for that.  It's not so much the free factor, but they saw we were having a good time, the alcohol was flowing, and really just trying all the food.  Bold and confident to be like, "Yo, try this steak out, son - it's bomb-deez!"  Okay, bartender didn't say it in those words, but you get the drift.  AMBIANCE - Tuesday hh is dead, or at least, the day that we went.    I probably won't suggest this place, but wouldn't mind returning here if some peeps wanted to go here.  That's almost strictly for the carpaccio.  dmo out

G9-FL2ED3Sm23QV2nOmfdQ.text: My husband and I tried Customshop recently as we live in the neighborhood. I was so disappointed when I looked at the menu. I don't eat pork or beef yet almost every single dish had both as ingredients. I wanted to order the spicy tuna meatballs as an appetizer and even those are made with ham. The waitress let me know they could do pasta without meat but why pay $28 for vegetarian pasta? I ended up ordering a TINY salad for my dinner that was nothing to write home about. My husband did order a steak and he was not impressed either. He did like the bbq octopus app, however.  I do not feel like this restaurant's menu caters to all types of eaters. Vegetarians or vegans, proceed with caution.  The ambience and service is five star, though, so I stuck with three stars instead of two. We won't be going back due to the limited menu options.

H46vHO0QRreyyfSEMxlu7A.text: Everyone who works here is very friendly and will go out of their way to make you feel at home. Great food too, and just the right portion sizes. I recommend the pork chops and the brussel sprouts as a side.

XD1HW54B6AuaQu67zIuRqA.text: The ambience is authentic and intimate, and the food is inspiring, flavorful, and feel good.    Go with a small group of good people for a great time, share a cheese board with some prosciutto, and start with the butter crunch lettuce (the best salad I've possibly ever had).    I had the most delicious pasta dish with pig tail meat last time... I think it was a special.  You really can't go wrong with any of the pasta dishes.

XGeSacWnbDXn1Z94bqN9NQ.text: We honestly went to this because we didn't have anything to do and just went in for a glass of wine but ended up being quite impressed! Ordered some appetizers and it was all delicious (specially the tuna). Would definitely recommend! :)

tayynXTI0vIUfC9qjTp1Bw.text: So bummed - this was our go to, never fail spot. Last night the food was so salty and I mean big huge chunks of salt on everything from the bread, beef tartare, goat cheese mousse and even the salad. I had to take a damn diuretic when I got home I was retaining so much water.

_xF1BmVuI54X7Wu4ZwHsSw.text: One of the most underrated restaurants in Charlotte.   Beef Carpaccio was perfect. Ribeye was mouthwatering. The bartender knows how to make a cocktail.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Carpaccio

3hMIuNg5wziOw81t-3y83Q.text: We ate here last weekend and thoroughly enjoyed it! Love the new vibe and the food was exceptional. The goat cheese mousse was wonderful, as well as the ribeye deckle. Our waiter Jonathan was very knowledgeable and attentive. Can't wait to come back!

_kR3x-vLUZFyvfEVtf2ofQ.text: The service here was very good. Our waiter gave great recommendations and was very honest about what dishes he didn't think were worth getting. The bread is absolutely incredible. We got the Barbecue Octopus, Yellow Fin Tuna Crudo, Pistachio Pesto Pasta, and Duck Ragu Linguini. Everything was delicious. I was hesitant to try octopus for the first time but I would highly recommend it. Not at all fishy and very smoky. Both pasta dishes were incredible and favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Duck Ragu Linguini and Pistachio Pesto Shrimp Pasta

WuaoFMQhamgPEUx8uOdBWA.text: I've been to Customshop a couple of times and it's always been enjoyable. The atmosphere is cool and trendy and the food and drinks are pretty darn good!  I have to say that you have to get, HAVE TO GET, the Brussel spouts... I'm gonna go out on a limb and say they are some of the best in Charlotte. They make them with a special method that I wasn't surprised when I heard... trust me, they are delicious... and I can't believe I went on a rant about a vegatable... but they are that good! Another thing I really likes about this place is that they give you a sweet something with each cheese on the cheese and chacuterie plate.  The service was awesome and it's a good place to celebrate a nice night out.

jxBMyboe3WowwD_gV1TEGg.text: I really enjoyed this place! The quality of the food is excellent as well as the value. The atmosphere is relaxing  in addition to  the service, my only minor complaint would be the speediness if the kitchen. My favorite picks are the seafood, cheeseboard and the bread pudding with ice cream.

W-SU0bTJeFjJWxNmevDRzg.text: I REALLY wanted the newly designed Customshop to be as amazing as my first meal (and several subsequent meals) there pre renovation.  While the newly designed space is beautiful, the food is lackluster, at best, with exception of the charcuterie board.  We ordered the filet, MR which came out cold in the center, the scallops were underdone and in a cold cauliflower puree.  The main course plates, for the price, were extremely small - and we aren't fill the whole plate people, but  a little accompaniment is always nice.  The ravioli was just fine..but again, they too came out room temp.  The cocktails and suggested wine with our main courses were exceptional and well chosen by our sever.  I do hope, the kitchen is still working out the kinks, would hate to see this restaurant not deliver on its potential to be a landmark Charlotte restaurant.

VU0RCYJYKTHRijnhGUfvcw.text: Love this restaurant - one of the best in Charlotte. A foodie kind of place with great service in a comfortable, neighborhood kind of space. The menu is inventive and the execution is top notch. The cocktails are fab and the wine list offers an excellent selection. Keep up the good work!

PpUsp6yfZgJDmqa69WarmA.text: We loved this restaurant. Definitely not our favorite now. We won't be back. We went tonight and the food was okay, however, the service was TERRIBLE. The bartender was overwhelmed and had the bar + a few tables + the entire restaurant's drinks. It took 2 1/2 hours from starting dinner to finish it dinner ( for 2 people! ). Some of our food was cold but we couldn't grab the bartenders attention to tell her. Too expensive for crappy service.

navJSGggpEwQx8ZLaeXxGw.text: I have to say that I'm really disappointed after finally visiting Customshop with my fiance. I've had it bookmarked for over a year probably, but never got the chance to try it.  Unfortunately our poor experience started right off the bat. We were immediately seated and given water glasses, but no waiter checked on us for 10 minutes until someone finally checked in. We just went ahead and made an order for the grilled octopus and chicken liver pate, planning on splitting both small plates. The grilled octopus was just okay. It was a little tough, which is almost expected with octopus/squid, but also tasted overwhelmingly of lemon. It wasn't bad but not a standout either. The chicken liver pate was really, really bad on the other hand. I can't even describe the taste, just incredibly offputting. We both tried two bites and couldn't stomach any more. The chocolate oatmeal bread on the side was okay, but not quite as delicious as it sounds. We were still very hungry so decided to try the ricotta gnocchi. They were incredibly soft gnocchi, like falling apart soft. The ricotta didn't add much flavor and the sauce tasted of too much tomato and not enough seasoning in my opinion. The sausage in the sauce was excellent, however.  Overall, we felt like we had 2 average at best dishes and 1 bad miss and decided it would be best to cut our losses, pay up our $55, and go home to eat some leftovers in order to actually be full.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled octopus
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken liver pâté with chocolate oatmeal bread
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ricotta Gnocchi

xX0O96LnbMnEnsrvpvYdrw.text: Our favorite restaurant in Charlotte! We only go for special occasions as it is pricy but you get what you pay for. Starting with the BREAD!!! I could eat the whole plate of that but it is the best focaccia I've ever had! I am constantly asking the waiter for more  because they usually only bring a couple pieces at a time. No shame! I also love the brussel sprouts and usually get whatever tuna special they have. My husband says the deckle is the best piece of meat he has ever had and RAVES about it to anyone who will listen! If you just had to get 2 things get the deckle and brussel sprouts! (And all the bread!)

n0PIZg7rhWpZXkhpBxy-IA.text: The wife and I had not been here in at least a couple of years, but decided to make last minute plans to revisit Customshop and check it out once again a few months back. We had a great meal that night and have now returned a couple more times. With several visits under our belts, I felt it was time to put in a review. The most recent visit started with adult beverages, I went with the blood orange negroni and the wife chose a glass of wine. Clearly, I'm not a negroni man because I didn't realize that this was a gin drink. No problem, I like gin and I was enticed by the blood orange anyway which made for a good flavor combo for me. The wife enjoyed her white wine, Chardonnay I believe.  For appetizers, the wife was torn but ultimately went with the burrata which came with some apricot jam and sadly only one piece of grilled bread. The bread was great, but more was needed especially due to the generous portion of burrata. I guess that we could have inquired about more. The bread nazi didn't shoot us down, we just didn't ask. I can vouch for the burrata and it was very good as the wife generously shared. I still got my own app which was a blue fin tuna belly. It also came with pork belly and the tuna was slightly cooked by pouring hot broth over it just before it was served. The pork belly was well cooked and the tuna belly fresh, but the broth was over the top good. Our sever even brought me over a spoon so that I could savor very last drop.   For mains, I kept it in the tuna family and this time got the yellow fin tuna and it was just seared to perfection keeping the tuna the star of the show to go along with the accompanying cauliflower puree and smoked almond romesco. The wife chose the fresh made in house pasta dish of ricotta cappelletti and we both easily cleaned our plates. With reason, we were well fed and skipped dessert on this occasion. The service was attentive and on point with explanations of all the specials and thoughtful with suggestions and questions answered. Customshop will easily become a new regular restaurant in our rotation. Sadly they no longer serve brunch, which they used to in the past. I guess it wasn't popular, too bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Another fresh pasta dish.
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gnocchi
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

LZmJaAI5D70o_lYvNCK4tA.text: I am so frustrated that we did not come to this fine establishment sooner, since it is in walking distance of our place. We sat at the bar and were immediately greeted by the bartender who took our drink order and provided us with menus. Here is a rundown of why this is a five star establishment.  Cocktails: yes, yes, yes! The bartender was so friendly and gave us some insight into the drink menu, which rotates seasonally. She seemed extremely tuned into what her customers like and what to change up during the year. We order the Cucumber Basil Smash and the Ginger Devil. They were so delicious that we ordered three more (good thing we were walking home).  Food: We had already ate some dinner, but were hungry for some snacks so we ordered a Charcuterie board and loved it so much that we order another one with a few different cheeses and meats. We also order the Tuna Meatballs which were melt in your mouth fabulous with the texture of a meatball and the freshness of tuna.   We are looking forward to walking back here on a summer night to have more cocktails, sit down for dinner and enjoy some desserts. Bravo Customshop!

ArqyCVs6HnIUUyzp63pyMg.text: Friends of ours invited us to customshop to celebrate our upcoming wedding and we were glad to go. We tried so many things! I can't even remember everything but we left full and happy. I recommend the fresh cheese/blueberry/honeycomb plate or the meat and cheese plate. We shared both. We also tried the octopus - the guys liked it and said it was not gummy or chewy at all. We had the steak and duck as mains; the steak was better than the duck. We finished with their in house made ice creams and a chocolate souffle. The ice creams were interesting flavor a but delicious. The only thing we didn't like all night was the pb&j ice cream. I'm sure dinner was a fortune but it was a special occasion after all!

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak and veggies on bottom  Duck with greens on top
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious hard cider
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pate with chocolate bread

qknPvmh8HLXcn7M9yVdAoQ.text: This place is really amazing and different.  The menu changes all the time I hear and that's the enjoyment of being here.  The ambiance and feel and mood is so inviting.  Our server Scott did a fantastic job and listening to his descriptions of the specials made us want to get each one.   The scallops were so good with a fantastic sauce.  The salads had great flavor and many of the veggies come from the chefs personal garden.  Bead pudding for desert and various ice creams had so much flavor. Brussels sprouts were a big hit at the table and a few said "best ever".  Gratin potatoes were not heavy with cheese like some.  The cheese plate was possibly the hit of the night.  Many different types with meats and sauces.  Exquisite wine selection with the "Roth" a big hit at the table tonight.  If you want a different dining experience that pushes the culinary limits this is a place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Main dining area
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gratin potatoes with sprouts and the Vavette steak  in the background
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area

hxNA_sUp5rmNgcLnUnpaiw.text: This restaurant is actually a favorite of mine because for the most part they have really good food. The only downside is that they get just so busy that the service is very inconsistent and therefore mistakes are likely to happen. I won't list all the mistakes made at our last meal like some people because  our dinner was still quite good. My only recommendation is to go early or on a weeknight when they are less crowded and less noisy. Tip, do not order the tuna meatball, it is not good at all.

6KslsrcZN_O9KARMO--CZw.text: I finally can say Charlotte has great restaurants!   We came with a group of friends.   Food: 1. Complementary bread with home made garlic butter spread: It's amazing!!!!   2. Small plates: a. Honey Cones: Made from heaven! 3 different types of local honey cones, with cheddar biscuits, blue berries and beets. Great combination and it's definitely something you don't see in any other restaurants!   b. Braised pork belly: crispy outside edges and juicy meat inside. I hate fatty meat, but I like this! Actually, I love this!   c. Brussel Sprouts: I hate Brussel Sprouts in general, but this one is crispy and blends well with the rest plates.   d. Bbq octopus: crunchy ends and thick and tend in the middle. Very flavorful! Very good! This is speaking from a non-octopus fan!   e. Spicy tuna meatballs: I had high hopes for this one, but was actually a little disappointed. Didn't taste too different from regular meatballs. This is probably the only one I won't order again.   3. Entrees: a. Smoke Duck: really good. Doesn't taste gamy, which is what I was worried about. Tastes very smoky! I like the flavor and the sides that come with it. Just a little too rare (ordered medium) for my preference. Everyone else loves it though.   b. Steak: flavor is good! Tasted good! Again, too rare for my liking, but everyone else loves it!   c. Ink Squid bucatini: good!   4. Desert: Bread pudding. Comes in a hot skillet. Rich flavor and tastes a little different than the ones I had in the past, and we all love it (everyone ordered the bread pudding. Two share one order, 3 orders in total)! It's very hearty, so if you want something more refreshing, try something different.   Service: the food came out fast and service is good. Try to come with group of friends so you can order different small plates! Also avoid Saturdays, it's going to be packed. We came on a Sunday night and it was totally worth the wait. Will definitely come here again with more friends!

14pVhZLye48AmmflKy5n8w.text: Fantastic spot, great atmosphere and attentive customer service. All the food was delicious but I have to say the souffle was to die for. Be reasonable if you want to last till dessert!! A must do in Charlotte for international foodies.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

JqqLSsWZPiHBDQHMdbgLGg.text: I really want to rate this 3.5 stars.  It is a good restaurant, but  to me just not knock your socks off good like some of the reviewers think.  I visited here a while back and thought it was OK, but it was restaurant week, so I wanted to try it again.  My husband and I visited before a play uptown on a Friday night.  We had early reservations and were seated promptly.  I had not been since they updated the decor and I really like the look. It is very cozy.  Our waitress was very nice and made a few recommendations for us.  We did not order any cocktails although they sounded good; we stuck with wine.  The bread service is a nice addition.  I wanted to love the food, but I found it to be good not great.  We had:  1-BBQ Octopus- I LOVE good grilled octopus and read several review that it was really good here.  Unfortunately it was WAY too chewy.  I am familiar with the texture, but this was bad as in we needed a steak knife to cut it.  We were not offered one though so took a lot of work cutting it to eat it.  The seasoning on it was really nice, but it was just too chewy to really enjoy.  I was so sad, but guess I'll stick to it at a place like Upstream.  2-Yellow Fin Tuna Crudo- This was yummy!  Very simple dish, although it was swimming in oil.  It could have had a bit less as it spilled all over the table.  Delish though.  3-Scallops-we got the special scallop dish that was on the menu that night.  The scallops were cooked very well and really enjoyed them.  The accompaniment did not quite mesh together and I think the dish that is listed on yelp on the regular menu sounds like it would have been better.  Would get scallops there again, just not this particular special from that night.  4-Brussel sprouts-One of my favorite foods so I always have to try them.  Especially after the rave reviews I saw.  These brussel sprouts were really good and would definitely get them again.  Not life changing like some of the reviewers think.  Try summit room for some of the best I've had in CLT.  Overall, we had a really nice dinner with good service.  Food was good, but not great.  At these prices you want it to be great!  There are so many great restaurants in town, I unfortunately don't think I"ll be a rush to get back.

UFJmh4Og5838lr94r3aIJA.text: My sister and I came here a couple weeks ago and had a great time. The food and service were wonderful. We ordered the brussel sprouts, grilled octopus, grouper crudo, chocolate souffle, and the pork belly. Yes we ordered a ton and loved every bite. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Belly over Candied cabbage
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brussels
Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grouper Crudo

JkyB6c5YbTzqSc-xEvfBUw.text: I had been a fan of here many years ago and had gotten away from it. I heard they recently renovated and thought I'd check it out.   Wow! Love the new interior, great service, incredible menu, and the food and cocktails were spot on. I had the pork chop and it's hands down the best one I have ever had in Charlotte. My friend and I both really took our time and savored the flavors of our apps and entrees. The cocktails we started with were nicely made and presented and we enjoyed the transition to a nice wine list with dinner.   You're going to spend some money here. Good for a special date night, occasion, or to spoil yourself. Definitely not the place I am ordering take-out from or would want to afford on a regular basis. When you do go, you don't feel like you've over paid at all.

64-LEZt0RkKvKR_CWsAW6g.text: I totally recommend this restaurant! Loved the food and Drinks were fantastic!! I die for a good Old Fashion and I was head over heels in love with this one. Yes, it was that good! Definitely a place you should check out in CLT!!

sVa4qxaLiR6gJhV9IW9eZg.text: The BEST server The BEST food The BEST cocktails The BEST wine The BEST ambiance   Custom shop will you marry me?

jFauVLGk7kif1rmf37BELg.text: I have been here twice and I feel like this place is "just okay". When we dined last night, we had a reservation for 6:30pm and when we got there we were the only people at the restaurant which I thought was awkward. However, by 7pm the place was buzzing so I would recommend getting a later reservation. Our cocktails were good - this is definitely a selling point for this place. Good bread and enjoyed the tuna appetizer (photographed) and the burrata. I got the steak which was just okay. My husband made the mistake of ordering the special-of-the-day and it ended up being $45. I dislike when they tell you the special and not what it costs but I know that isn't uncommon practice. Overall, our bill for two apps, two drinks, and two entrees was $155 which I felt was expensive for a "meh" meal. After two times trying this place, I probably will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yellow Fin Tuna Crudo

uFi9JPMO_TgSMTGu6Q9lAQ.text: Definitely one of my Top favorite restaurants in Charlotte. They have amazing sharing plates and main courses. I always order a Crudo if some sort. Great drink choices.

uSDieYJU8c82xQdf-n-0GA.text: When the big eyeball emojis are staring at you from the table, take that as an indication to order some wine.   Other than that, listen carefully to the specials your waiter tells you about. There are some winners there that you should take note of.   Our dining experience here was excellent, mostly due to our awesome server who we all pretty much were crushing on in a 90s sitcom kind of way. He was funny, charming and overall, on top of his game.   I went a little bit out of my normal lane and ordered the Squid Ink Linguine alla Chitarra. Didn't really think I could go wrong with squid ink and shellfish, but must not have read through the description carefully enough and to my surprise, came in a red sauce. It was tasty and made sense with the sausage also in there, but pretty much me and everyone at the table were a little surprised. (Looking back at the description, it's not completely clear but I should have asked.)  My friends ordered the scallops and risotto, which I believe was one of the specials. One bite of it gave me food envy, so if it was on the menu I would definitely re-order that again for myself.  Overall, the small plates were a highlight for me, with the BBQ Octopus and Burrata as the two standouts of the night for me. Obviously, there are just enough for a few bites each if shared, however small but mighty definitely applied to both.

Photo of Customshop Handcrafted Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crudo

veeYXai65YY8xuJfCyiWvQ.text: Oouuuuffff! I've loved Customshop pre-renovation, and I'm captivated by it a la post-renovation. We went on the opening night; and the ambiance, food, drinks, and service were all spectacular!  My friend was encouraging a special drink, and I was looking for a non/low-alcoholic drink that night. The bartender Zoe suggested and offered a sample of this ginger beer, which I did order. She was so sweet!  And our server Jonathan was very accommodating that he recommended amazing starters, entrees, and dessert catered to our cravings we had that night. They were all showstoppers. As a starter, the goat cheese mousse was Divine. As our shared entree, the Lady Edison porkchop was impeccably seasoned and so tender. The pairing of the marinated pears with the porkchop was unexpectedly a savorful surprise! Last but definitely not the least, the chocolate peanut butter tart... WHOA BABY! I even got an extra slice for to-go.  I'm finished rambling. I'm anticipating my return to this restaurant!

6W66uAE8rquRNsKzPxAFiA.text: I would absolutely recommend customshop! Id first like to brag on the the super sweet hostess who greeted us, I wish I'd gotten her name because she really stood out and made a great first impression. The restaurant was thoughtfully decorated and had a great ambiance, it was welcoming, a tad busy but not loud. We started with burrata di bufala and it was delicious! The bread it was served with was amazing, definitely recommend this dish! The saffron linguini was also a must try. Everything here was spot on from the food, to the atmosphere, and especially the friendly staff. Can't wait to go back!

jAXIzAZcX2iBU7RJiWlyxg.text: Let me start by saying I really wanted to like Customshop again- it was one of our favorite spots for years, so was optimistic that the rebuild would put things back on track. Unfortunately, our meal missed across the board.   The restaurant ambiance wise is chic inside, but the noise level was absolutely deafening. Our reservation was at 6:30 on a weeknight, so having to yell across a four top to hear anything was unfortunate. The service was mediocre and the bar was backed up throughout the night, but would rather focus on the details of our food:  Bread: A highlight of the meal, could eat 10 plates worth. Great crust with fluffy inside, olive oil and pepper to top it off. Goat cheese mousse: Tasted more like creme cheese; lacking that tart, earthy flavor. Crab and Shrimp Ceviche: Absence of acidity and seasoning made the dish taste noticeably fishy. No chips or bread for scooping. BBQ Octopus w/ Gnocchi: Octopus overcooked and rubbery. Gnocchi was actually quite good but overpowered by the bbq sauce. Lamb Shank w/ Mushroom Risotto: Lamb was tender but desperately needed salt/seasoning. Risotto overcooked like porridge and lack of salt made the sauce sweet not savory. Duck Breast: The chef suggested temperature of medium came out rare (not surprising for duck), but the lack of fat rendering made the strong "duck" taste overwhelming. Pork Chop: Delicious, well-balanced flavors. Mustard Anglaise was great, and the fingerlings were nicely cooked.  Tip, tax, and wine included, the bill ran easily within the $$$ range. While I'd like to say otherwise, we won't be returning to Customshop anytime soon.

z8iFTffa39XjfhBhM--Q8Q.text: Customshop provided a nice welcome dinner on my recent visit to Charlotte. Our group of four was seated in a cozy booth, and our server was personable and attentive.   We started with some shared plates: burrata, tuna crudo, octopus. I really liked the burrata. The tuna crudo was pretty but dainty - one small bite per person, plus one remaining bite that everyone was too polite to claim for themselves.   For drinks, I enjoyed the smoky old fashioned followed by several glasses of wine which were recommended by our server. All of the wines were excellent and our server's pairing advice was spot-on!  I was super bummed that the pumpkin ravioli was unavailable but happy to try the scallops and risotto special. It was very good! I also tried the squid ink linguini which was nice, though we were all surprised that it came in a red sauce since that wasn't mentioned in the description. We all shared a side of the fingerling potatoes, and I feel pretty confident that I ate at least half the dish. So good!   One small critique is that the menu is kind of on the small side. I think with a few more options, Customshop could easily be a five star dinner option. Regardless, I'd be happy to return on another visit to Charlotte!

LCl9iupoQ1XX2TlZGnbGzg.text: I haven't had a really fabulous main dish like this in a long time! Especially one where I truly wanted to lick the plate after I was done. Hats off to you Customshop, because I will think of you and drool.  I ordered the special, the scallops and risotto. Scallops were light and fluffy, the way they should be, as well as the risotto being a nice creamy texture. Seriously, plate licking should have been involved.  We also ordered a round of apps for the table. The burrata was good, although not as creamy and rich as I remember others being. The squid was good too, but it wasn't impressive like my dish was. This however will not change my view that this is a solid restaurant to visit!   Service was stellar, as our server was super friendly and attentive. He did a good job of suggestions on food and drinks. So good that I left definitely feeling very happily buzzed on some great wine. Whoops!

fUUw1ErM-ti1bgSqqJmKuw.text: On an evening where basically every other restaurant was packed full (aka Valentine's Day), Customshop was one of basically no restaurants with reservations left.  Me, being semi-anal about having actual reservations before going anywhere that is going to be packed, plucked the last available spot on OpenTable.    The restaurant itself is conveniently located in Elizabeth (close enough to Uptown) along a street with many other popular restaurants such as Carpe Diem and Passion8.  The lighting is pretty dim, but it matches the atmosphere of the restaurant, which isn't too loud or too quiet, but just right... maybe because the entire restaurant was of couples? We were seated closely to another table, but didn't have to listen to their conversation the whole night.  Our server, Zoe, was an absolutely delight and was super friendly to us the whole evening.  The drinks took a little long to arrive, but it may have been because it was a full house... so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.  As for food, we chose to order a bunch of small plates and one main entree: - Tuna crudo - slightly different texture than what I'm used to, but the flavor was okay.  Could have been a bit more tangy - Beef carpaccio - holy moly this was the motherlode of all beef carpaccios.  It's a LOT for two people.   - Razor clams - best flavor of the night, but some of them were a little overcooked and very chewy - Pork belly - could have been a little more melt-in-your-mouth and was rather bland - BBQ octopus - I was a little apprehensive about ordering BBQ anything, but this actually turned out to be the best dish of the evening.  I liked that it had a little kick to it and was more flavorful than the other dishes - Smoked duck - cooked just right... loved the crispy skin.  Overall, the food was a bit lackluster in that many of the dishes simply were not flavorful, salty enough, or just quite bland.  BUT... for dessert, I ordered the brownie souffle with coffee ice cream and that solved all my issues for the night. The souffle was the perfect amount of chocolate - not too rich, and just melty enough.  The cold ice cream and the melty goodness of the souffle complemented each other so well. I ate the entire thing by myself, thanks to my dinner companion that evening, and have zero regrets!  Excellent service and atmosphere, blandish food, but amazing dessert.  Prices were reasonable.

sjg5nf108jrpBERtX4cA9g.text: What a great little spot. Fun atmosphere and friendly, helpful server. She recommended a great wine that was not on the list at a reasonable price. We shared a bunch of stuff and everything was delicious. The crudo was off the charts and our server recommended a pasta dish with pesto and shrimp that was fantastic. A bit pricey but worth it for the quality of the food, plating and service.
